Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2011 06:05AM mnmom3 wrote: I think we all do it...We had a vacation planned in March 2010, I was diagnosed in Feb 2010. My guy had a bought a ring and was going to propose. We decided not to get married because of all the uncertainty. We live together and he has been wonderful. I have three daughters, they are 19,24.26 and even  though they are grown there are still so many things that I am going to miss. I wanted  to be the mother of the bride and a Grandma. Just had my 8th round of TCH and I'm feeling good Scans after the next round. Take care. Marsha

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2011 06:39AM mnmom3 wrote: Jenn, I have widespread bone mets all though my spine, the pain when I was diagnosed was unbearable, I am unable to take Vicodan or percocet so my onc prescribed Morphine and it was fantastic. Chemo and Zonmeta helped the pain too too. I was taking morphine every fours the first 4 months and have only taken it twice since June of 2010. I am getting my second neulesta shot today and I am hoping to not have bone pain I still remember how much it hurt. Best of Luck Marsha

Posts.Content: mnmom3 wrote: Just need to talk, having a lot of cardiac issues due to herceptin, my last infusion was Nov 8 th have had 3 low mugas...39,46 and last week it was 41. Seeing a cardiologist tomorrow. Started arimidex in Dec I have been so sad this last couple of weeks, it is almost 2 years since diagnosis...I have been crying a lot and just having a hard time with everything...no energy, everything is an effort, focusing on how much I lost to cancer. These boards have had been hard. I am not sure how much of this is my new normal or the arimidex? Posts.Content: mnmom3 wrote: Got the results of the Bone Scan, Muga and CT. Muga is good can continue with the Herceptin. CT showed that the Primary tumor in the breast is gone, the other organs are all clear. I had 2 liver spots at diagnosis they are gone. The bones mets were widespread and they show regression and no new activity. I had my 5th round of TCH today and we are going to continue the TCH until something changes. I seem to be handling the side effects pretty good, the bone after the the Neulasta shot is tough and so are the night sweats and hot flashes anyone have tips to handle the sweats and flashes? Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2012 02:44AM mnmom3 wrote: When I was married, my husband was a corporate guy, and believed he needed to live a certain lifestyle, so I have had a lot of "new" and matched things. We did a lot of entertaining. Now I love my townhome it is cozy, and I only have it furnished with pieces I love, not what is in style. What I have never had is a room of my own, such as a reading room, I would have loved a room with a big oversized reading chair, the wall painted a blue lavender, white trim, floor to ceiling book shelves, lace curtains and a lock on the door. Marsha

Posts.Content: mnmom3 wrote: Received the results today and the tumors in my liver are gone and the bone mets which are quite extensive, have all decreased and there is no progression anywhere. Should get a good nights sleep tonight. Marsha  Dx 2/19/2010, IDC, 5cm, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 3/5/2010 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 1/28/2011 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxol (paclitaxel) Hormonal Therapy 12/14/2011 Arimidex (anastrozole) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pet Scan Good news mnmom3 3katz

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2011 06:00PM mnmom3 wrote:  I did 9 rounds of taxol, carbo and herceptin and had great results...the hair loss was hard I cut it short and then had it shaved before it completely fell out. The fatigue was difficult and I was moody. I never had a problem with nausea, the steriods caused some weight gain. Best of luck, I am also part of a online dating success story. I live in Minneapolis, have considered Mayo, but really love my cancer center and feel that I am getting top notch treatment. Marsha

Posts.Title: Having liver biopsy today justjudie K-Lo

Posts.Content: mnmom3 wrote: Received my 2nd  CT/bone scan results on Tuesday, after 9 rounds of TCH. The breast, liver and all other organs are clear. The bones are stable. I am now going to Herceptin only to see if that can hold the cancer at bay. Will be glad to be off the Taxol and Carbo, am going to a cabin with my daughters and sisters next week. In September I am going to California so I should feel great. Quick question how long until my hair starts to return?
